Yes
No errors found
Public-Key-Pins: It should be used, since this way allows the host to send a set of cryptographic prints from the Certification Authority
Referrer-Policy: When not checked, the amount of information in the navigation is not controlled
Strict-Transport-Security: Content is not showing on Https
X-Content-Type-Options: Without this directive, the browser will try to discover the MIME type of the file, which may include malicious files, causing the browser to recognize them
X-Frame-Options: In case of not being controlled, page content is vulnerable to click-jacking attacks
X-XSS-Protection: Does not specify the activation of the filter against XSS of the browsers
Server: It should be checked that the information in this field does not match the actual one, as it can give clues. Information Found:
Back
Previous Tests
No previous results
Analysis of the domain\'s Http methods
Analysis of the domain\'s headers
Connect: This method will allow an attacker to use the server as a proxy
"The use of own methods can be a problem for the system, exploitable by an attacker "
DELETE: This method allows an attacker to delete server files
PUT: This method allows an attacker to upload malicious files to the server
TRACE: This method allows to return as \"echo\", a string that has been sent to the server. This can be used to perform a Cross Site Tracing attack

Robot.txt\'s analysis
Including the /admin/ in your disallow\'s paths you are showing the attackers where can them find the admin\'s login page
The existence of a profile path can allow the extraction of information about the system configuration
The existence of non-html files in the robots file, can give clues about sensitive data to search
Including the folder of info.php you are allowing the attackers to access to critical information
The existence of an installation file, allows to extract great amount of data to the attackers
The existence of a installation path, allows to extract great amount of data to the attackers in case it contains files
The existence of this route can be a security risk
The existence of a profile path can allow the extraction of information about the system configuration
The existence of a file update.php, can bring vulnerabilities in the system when giving information to the attackers
The existence of a test route may allow exploitation of not tested systems that put this system in high danger
